com.googlecode.lanterna

Class CJKUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.lanterna.CJKUtils

  • public class CJKUtils
extends Object
    Utilities class for analyzing and working with CJK (Chinese, Japanese, Korean) characters. The main purpose of this class is to assist in figuring out how many terminal columns a character (and in extension, a String) takes up. The main issue is that while most latin (and latin-related) character can be trusted to consume one column in the terminal, CJK characters tends to take two, partly due to the square nature of the characters but mostly due to the fact that they require most space to distinguish.
    Author:
    Martin
